definition: farewell dinner party
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together
cooked rice/CL:碗[wan3]/meal/CL:頓|顿[dun4]/(loanword) fan/devotee

sentences.english: Friday, personal email? That equals goodbye lunch as in byebye.
sentences.chinese: 星期五，个人邮箱？直接等于散伙饭，就是拜拜。

sentences.english: He had a farewell dinner with his classmates to mark the end of university days.
sentences.chinese: 他和同学一起吃了顿散伙饭，以纪念大学生活的结束。

sentences.english: "Disband Dinner" takes condoms as souvenir, what's your view?
sentences.chinese: 高校散伙饭安全套做纪念，你怎么看？

sentences.english: June 28, the whole class gathered to have the last dinner.
sentences.chinese: 六月二十八号晚上，全班同学聚集在一起吃散伙饭。

definition: to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
(of a theater) to empty/(of a show) to end
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
graduation ceremony/commencement exercises
farewell party
see 天下沒有不散的筵席|天下没有不散的筵席[tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan2 xi2]
pinyin: tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan4 xi2

definition: all good things must come to an end (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan2 xi2

military practice, esp. for reservists or new recruits/military training as a (sometimes compulsory) subject in schools and colleges/drill
dinner party/banquet
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
